info.title: Lobby Data API
info.description: API Specification and documentation for the Lobby Data System

get.description: This route returns a list of all organizations in the system.
This route returns a list of all bots in the specified organization. It requires an organization ID parameter to identify the organization.

post.description: This route creates a new bot configuration within in the specified organization. It requires an organization ID parameter to identify the organization to create the new bot in. It also requires a user_id to act as the owner of that bot. The owner of a bot has the highest level of access to use/modify the bot by default.

get.description: This route returns a list of all documents associated with the specified bot. It requires an organization ID parameter to identify the organization, and a bot ID parameter to identify the bot.

post.description: This route creates a new document document in the specified bot in the specified organization. It requires an organization ID parameter to identify the organization, and a bot ID parameter to identify the bot. It also requires a JSON payload in the request body that contains the document's details, such as the source_url, text content, and document title.

get.description: This route returns a list of all users in the system. Each entry specifies the user id and the IDs of the organizations that user is associated with.

post.description: This route creates a new user in the system. By default the user will be created along with a new organization, but an organization id can be provided in the request body to create the user within an existing organization instead.

get.description: This route lists all conversations of the specified user. The returned conversations can be filtered by bot id, organization id, or both.

post.description: This route creates a new conversation for the specified user.  The new conversation is associated with the organization id and bot id provided in the request body.

get.description: This route returns a list of all messages in the specified user conversation ordered by descending created time. (Most recent message last in the list)

post.description:
This route generates a new message in the specified user conversation. The request body requires the bot id, organization id, and input fields.

num_message_history is the max number of messages that will be included as chat history during the generation of the new message.

If full_conversation is set to true, a list of all conversation messages will be returned instead of the newly generated message. (Same response format as [List conversation messages](api-3485867))

This route includes a streaming option which will return partial messages in the form of server sent events. By default these events each contain a distinct fragment of the final message. If "accumulate" is set to true, each event will include all generated fragments up to that point.

When streaming is enabled, the last data message received will contain the same response as when streaming is disabled, this will either be the standard newly generated message or the list of al conversation messages if "full_conversation" is set to true.

get.description: This route returns a the details of a specific bot in the specified organization. It requires an organization ID parameter to identify the organization to search within and a bot ID.

This route returns the details of a specific document associated with the specified bot. It requires an organization ID parameter to identify the organization, and a bot ID parameter to identify the bot.
This route retrieves all conversation details of the specified conversation. This route requires a user id and conversation id.
This route returns a list of all users in the specified organization. The list of use details includes the organization id, user id, and scopes within the specified organization.

This route returns the details of the specified user. It requires a user ID parameter to identify the user. The list returned contains each relationship that the specified user has to an organization, the id of the organization, and the scopes the user has in the specified organization.
This route returns a list of all users in the specified organization. It requires an organization ID parameter to identify the organization.

post.description: This route will add the specified user to an existing organization with the specified organization id
